page.title: 08Bondleigh Farmhouse/building
page.content: Many of{Devon's cob and thatch}farm dwellings have now disappeared, the outside walls plastered, thatch replaced by slate.{Farm buildings } replaced firstly by stone with slate or galvanised iron roofing, to be followed in the 1960's by erection of {large covered yards}constructed of precast concrete with asbestos roofing. Today farm buildings are built of various materials including steel and{timber}which have gained populartity for{natural appearence.} Mostly imported it is treated with preservative to prolong duration. {Cattle}are housed in large open yards with separate sleeping and feeding areas.{Milking cows}sleep in cow kennels giving each cow its own lying space. Milking{parlours}equipped with m/machines and{refrigersated milk} {tanks}are situated in close proximity.
